Legal_Issue: Whether the Board's decision rejecting the applicant's refugee claim due to adequate state protection and a viable Internal Flight Alternative (IFA) was reasonable
Application_Facts: Applicant claimed refugee status due to fear of violence from her former partner
Decision_Outcome: Board rejected claim citing state protection and IFA
Remedy_Requested: Judicial review of the Board’s decision
Grounds_for_Claim: Fear of violence from former partner
Assessment_Factor: Existence of state protection, viability of Internal Flight Alternative (IFA)
Evidence_Used: Evidence regarding state protection and conditions in proposed IFA location
Application_Basis: Fear of persecution due to gender-based violence
Evidence_Assessed: Board's evaluation of state protection and IFA
Relief_Sought: Overturning of Board’s negative decision on refugee claim
Governing_Rule: Board's findings on state protection and IFA are reviewed for reasonableness, requiring deference unless outside acceptable range of outcomes
Harm_Assessment: Risk of harm from former partner in country of origin
Cause_Description: Applicant feared returning to home country due to threats from former partner
Evidence_Handling: Board reasonably assessed evidence on state protection and IFA
Evidence_Assessment: Board found evidence supported existence of state protection and viable IFA
Decision_Rationale: The Board reasonably concluded that adequate state protection existed and the Internal Flight Alternative was viable based on the evidence and legal principles
